meanings.sent1: The soldiers built a praesidium to protect the city from invaders.
meanings.sent2: The castle's high walls served as a praesidium against enemy attacks.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended their treehouse was a praesidium, guarding against imaginary monsters.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a praesidium, shielding her from the sadness around her.
meanings.sent5: The glowing force field acted as a praesidium, keeping the alien spaceship safe.

meanings.definition: A body of troops stationed to protect a particular place.
meanings.sent1: The praesidium of soldiers stood watch at the entrance to the village.
meanings.sent2: The king assigned a praesidium of knights to guard the royal treasury.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels formed a praesidium to defend their acorn stash from the mischievous raccoons.
meanings.sent4: The security team acted as a praesidium, ensuring the safety of the important guests.
meanings.sent5: The loyal praesidium of guards surrounded the queen, ready to protect her at all costs.

meanings.sent1: Wearing a helmet is a praesidium for your head during sports.
meanings.sent2: The antivirus software on your computer acts as a praesidium against cyber threats.
meanings.sent3: Carrying an umbrella is like having a praesidium against unexpected rain showers.
meanings.sent4: Her friendship was a praesidium, always there to support and protect him.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse served as a praesidium, guiding ships safely through the stormy waters.
